plugin.help:
Configure MySQL ${product.version} for Monitoring

The MySQL ${product.version} plugin monitors the MySQL server using standard status queries. The only prerequisites for enabling monitoring are:

  • The configured mysql must have the ability to connect to the MySQL server specified by the ${jdbcUrl}
  • The user ${jdbcUser} is able to execute the following statements: 'SHOW GLOBAL STATUS', 'SHOW SLAVE STATUS', 'SHOW DATABASES' (minimal privileges needed: SELECT, REPLICATION CLIENT)
      Examples:
      mysql> create user 'hqagent'@'localhost' identified by 'hqagent';
      mysql> grant show databases on *.* to 'hqagent'@'localhost';
      mysql> grant select on *.* to 'hqagent'@'localhost';
  • To enable full process monitoring of the MySQL daemon the agent user must either own the process or have permissions to view all process stats.

Shared properties (values propagate to child services):

  • process.query - The SIGAR process query detecting the MySQL instance. Ordinarily you will not need to change this.
  • jdbcUrl - The MySQL JDBC Url to connect to the server:port and database. This takes the form of "jdbc:mysql://hostname:port/database". To connect to a running server with default settings on localhost use "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306" (port 3306 is MySQL default, specified in my.cnf)
  • jdbcUser - Username for MySQL login for status checks (see above)
  • jdbcPassword - Password for MySQL login

Monitoring properties affect log tracking, described below.

The Table Service is specified by a regular expression see the java.util.Pattern class for more info on java regular expressions. To monitor multiple tables use the | (or) delimiter, to monitor all tables use the ".*" regex. To ignore Table Services leave the field blank.
Please Note: information_schema tables are ignored.

Check Auto-Discover Global Statuses and Replications? if you want these child services auto-discovered.
